title: Croydon
summary: Croydon is a large town in South London, England that gives its name to the London Borough of Croydon. It is one of the largest commercial districts in Greater London, with an extensive shopping district and night-time economy.[2] The entire town[3] had a population of 192,064 as of 2011,[4] whilst the wider borough had a population of 384,837.  It is 9.4 miles (15.1Â km) south of Charing Cross.
